definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Do you think this is going to affect voter turnout?
sentences.chinese: 你们是否认为这会影响选民投票率？

sentences.english: Voter turnout was low for the election.
sentences.chinese: 这次选举的选民投票率很低。

sentences.english: This is a great stretch for turn-out.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个伟大的延伸的投票率。

sentences.english: It did win Jaffna though on a turnout of only about 20 percent.
sentences.chinese: 他们确实赢得了贾夫纳，但是投票率仅有20%。

sentences.english: Within-country comparisons also generally find that CV boosts turnout.
sentences.chinese: 国内比较研究也发现强制投票制可以提高选民投票率。

sentences.english: In the last two mid-term elections, voter turnout has gone up.
sentences.chinese: 在最近两次中期选举中，选民投票率均有所上升。

sentences.english: One reason which contributed to the high turn-out rate was voters' confidence in the future of Macau.
sentences.chinese: 投票率高的另一个原因是选民对前途有信心。

sentences.english: Democrats hope for a high turnout and careful co-ordination of votes.
sentences.chinese: 民主派寄望高投票率，及要小心配票。

sentences.english: But he says there were many provinces where turnout was high.
sentences.chinese: 但是他表示，许多省份的投票率都很高。

definition: referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]
